text:
Hi all, I'm looking to connect with anyone who has experience with (UK) public sector content marketing. Also interested in recommendations for influencers, books or blogs in that sphere or on the topic. 

Just took my first role in health care services and it's a different beast from the start ups/private sectoe I was familiar with! Keen to learn more and bring over new ideas.

text: Do you use a dock for your Macbook pro with two screens? I’m looking for a dock recommendation, i bought a Belkin dock but it has been unreliable. Please recommend one you’re happy with!

elements.text: Do you use a dock for your Macbook pro with two screens? I’m looking for a dock recommendation, i bought a Belkin dock but it has been unreliable. Please recommend one you’re happy with!

text: I’ve got two external screens, and MBP with closed lit. External keyboard and mouse. This works best for me. Can’t recommend any docks unfortunately

elements.text: I’ve got two external screens, and MBP with closed lit. External keyboard and mouse. This works best for me. Can’t recommend any docks unfortunately

text: <@U014PRHQUQ2> and your macbook doesn’t overheat? I was running mine directly through the macbook and it kept overheating, which is why i opted for a dock solution

text: on a similar note, does anyone have a desk chair they really like? I was thinking of going to pick mine up from the office but I didn't love it so I'm debating just buying a new one since it seems like we'll still be doing this for months

text:
herman miller aeron chairs are like $800 new, but there are always (perfectly good) used ones online for ~$200-300.

totally worth it if you spend 8+ hours a day in it.

i've gotten two from craigslist (one for me, one for the spouse).

text: Hi, Janet. I wrote a two-part series that offers a how-to. Maybe you'll find it helpful. <https://languagearts.xyz/blog/content-audit>

attachments.title: Caring For Your Content: The importance of the content audit — Language Arts
attachments.text: When, how and why you should perform a content audit. This article is part one of a two-part series. It includes tool recommendations for a do-it-yourself content inventory and introduces the reader to our website audit service.
attachments.fallback: Language Arts: Caring For Your Content: The importance of the content audit — Language Arts

elements.text: Hi, Janet. I wrote a two-part series that offers a how-to. Maybe you'll find it helpful.

text:
Interesting. What do you think of this?

Anybody in here at Shopify?

TLDR
Shopify's content team is now changing from Content Strategy to Content Design 

UPDATE: Their Strategy team was the UX team.

<https://ux.shopify.com/designing-a-name-52f45a70f16a|https://ux.shopify.com/designing-a-name-52f45a70f16a>

attachments.title: Designing a name
attachments.text: Why we’re changing the job titles of our content team

elements.text:
Interesting. What do you think of this?

Anybody in here at Shopify?

TLDR
Shopify's content team is now changing from Content Strategy to Content Design 

UPDATE: Their Strategy team was the UX team.
https://ux.shopify.com/designing-a-name-52f45a70f16a

text: At Shopify, Content Strategy = UX writing

elements.text: At Shopify, Content Strategy = UX writing

text: Not content marketing

elements.text: Not content marketing

text: It’s always been very confusing and annoying for people, especially here in Toronto. I accidentally attended the Content Strategy Meetup and joined the Content Strategy Slack and realized after it was too late that it was not, in fact, content [marketing] strategy.

elements.text: It’s always been very confusing and annoying for people, especially here in Toronto. I accidentally attended the Content Strategy Meetup and joined the Content Strategy Slack and realized after it was too late that it was not, in fact, content [marketing] strategy.

text: I think this name change makes SO MUCH MORE SENSE

elements.text: I think this name change makes SO MUCH MORE SENSE

text: Seems like it’s a way to align teams internally?

elements.text: Seems like it’s a way to align teams internally?

text: What is? The name change?

elements.text: What is? The name change?

text:
Ah, <@URAV154AV>, that makes more sense! 

I guess if I had noticed, it is on the UX blog. 

Yes, content strategy and UX are different lanes.

, that makes more sense!

text: Haha. I bet that was a shocker when you went to the Meetup, <@URAV154AV>!
